Fields.DialogueText: Boo!
Gah!

Fields.MenuText: I wasn't scared. Just... surprised.
Manchester, I almost spilled my coffee!
You're lucky I didn't punch you.

Fields.DialogueText: You jumped so high I thought you'd go overboard!
Well, I had no idea your mug was full!
If you had, I would've decked ya right back!
Why do you torture me so?
It's a quiet morning for once. I should check on the bridge crew before--
Gotcha! Scared ya, didn't I, Cap'n?
What torture? It's just some fun an' games!
Doesn't look like football.
Oh, and I wanted to let you know somethin' as well.
Let me know what?
That there's Morganas headin' this way.
Couldn't you have told me without spooking me?
I thought it would be more fun this way! Come on, let's get stuck in!
Sound the alarm and get to stations!
@BATTLE
Cap'n, I had a question.

Fields.MenuText: I temper my expectations.
Should I be worried?
Yes, we can get some more whiskey. No, you can't bring dockworkers aboard for football again.

Fields.DialogueText: What d'ya need those for, anyway?
When have I ever done ya wrong?
That was one time! It weren't my fault they drank up all the booze we had.
I just wondered if you knew what a butfor was.
Huh? A butfor?
Aye, a butfor.
What the heck is a butfor?
For sittin' on, of course!
You know, you're worse than Ark Royal at times.
I try.
*ALARM*
Why don't you tell the Morganas your jokes?
They're not the joking type, but some shells should be good for a laugh!
@BATTLE
Cap'n!
And there that goes.
Well, it's a fairly quiet day today. Hopefully this keeps--
There goes what?
Never mind. What is it, Manchester?
Well, I had wondered if you wanted to go and talk to Lenny the medic.

Fields.MenuText: Does he need more supplies?
If it's about the mummy incident, I've already punished those responsible.
I hadn't thought about it. Why?

Fields.DialogueText: No... thankfully, it landed squarely.
That was quite the laugh, but no. But it gives me an idea for--
Erm... Well...
I might've put a bucket of ice-cold water above the door to his quarters...
Absolutely not. Why don't you talk to him yourself?
... What landed squarely?
Manchester.
Might've talked him into opening the door and getting soaked...
... Fine. I'll deal with the sopping wet Welshman.
Thanks, Cap'n! I'll deal with the Morganas in the meantime!
*ALARM*
Just don't pull any heroics!
@BATTLE
Ack! Run, lads!
Hold up, men! What's the problem?

Fields.MenuText: Water pressure in the pipes give?
Does the water heater need fixing up again?
I hope it's not a spider.

Fields.DialogueText: Not exactly!
Heater got fettled up last week, Cap'n!
You could say that!
She's a bloody peeping tom!
Oh, pipe down! 'S'not like I got a good look. I was enjoying watching you run away like schoolgirls, anyways!
Manchester, could you stop tormenting the crew for a while?
I can't help it if I'm bored, Cap'n! Gotta keep my brains active!
Well, there's got to be something more productive than spooking the sailors.
At least it keeps 'em on their toes!
*ALARM*
Speaking of which, there's the alarm. Get dressed and get to stations.
This should give you some action, Manchester.
@BATTLE
I don't like this.
Any word from the rest of the crew?
Do you think it's... too quiet?
Nothing, sir. You don't think...
Oh! Good day, Cap'n!

Fields.MenuText: Manchester is... holding a book? Am I dreaming right now?
That... doesn't look like a pulp magazine to me.
Lenny, you have my permission to slap me to make sure I'm not seeing things.

Fields.DialogueText: If you are, you've got some borin' dreams, Captain!
Good eyes, Cap'n! That's 'cause it isn't!
Oh, can I do it? Er... on second thought, I probably shouldn't, eh?
What is that?
It's a book, of course!
I know, but what's the title?
Oh! It's a copy of "The Condition of the Working Class in England!"
That sounds a lot more... dense... than I thought you'd be reading.
It's specifically concerned with my namesake city! Why wouldn't I read it?
I suppose it makes sense.
Speaking of sense... I sense some Morganas heading our way!
@BATTLE
Hmm? Oh, yeah. Well, it is my favourite book. It's quite the edifyin' read.
Is that so? Colour me intrigued. What does it say about the working classes?
It's a little unsettling seeing you just sitting there reading instead of pulling pranks.
Well, here about the working-class Englishman and his labour movements, it says...
"In our present society, he can save his manhood only in hatred and rebellion against the bourgeoisie."
Cap'n?

Fields.MenuText: Are you sure you're not reading the Communist Manifesto?
What was that about "manhood?"
I guess that explains why you're a redhead.

Fields.DialogueText: Nope! That was Marx! This is Friedrich Engels. Both German, so I understand the confusion.
Just basically that working men are emasculated by the aristocracy in charge of the factories. Rebellion fixes that right up!
You say that, but Belfast is redder than I am!
Erm, hairwise, that is.
I... have to say that I'm surprised. I never pegged you for a communist.
Marxist technically, Cap'n! I would've thought it obvious, Manchester bein' a city of the working class!
*ALARM*
Mind working on some Morganas?
Love to! I'll show them how we employ the means of destruction!
@BATTLE
Hey, Cap'n, I was wonderin'...

Fields.MenuText: There'd better not be a pun at the end of this.
Please don't waste more ice water on another bucket stunt.
I think I've heard quite enough about Engels on the working class this past week.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not as shameless as Ark, Cap'n!
Oh, I've moved beyond buckets!
Well, it's your fault for tellin' me you were interested!
The crew take exception at times with your decisions between battles.
Such as?
And some o' the others seem to think there's a discipline problem. Somethin' about a ship spirit havin' the run of the place.
... Manchester, that's your fault.
And anyway, they're sailors. Their duty is to follow my orders, even if they don't like them, just as it's mine to keep them a cohesive fighting force.
We're a ship of war, and we need discipline.
Don't I have a say in it?
Of course you do. But I'm your captain too, and what I say ultimately goes.
That's not very fair, now, is it?
It is, actually. Was there anything else?
Hmm... nope!
All right, then.
Oh! And there's some Morganas incoming!
You only tell me now!?
@BATTLE
Training quibbles. The gunners want more practice with me.
Captain, if you've got a moment--
It'll have to wait!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Captain--
Not now.
It's about medical supplies for the infirmary. Specifically new tweezers and--
Bandages.
Yes, those too.
The cook's already told me that the freezers need more ice and the gunnery officers want more training with Manc in the schedule.
You'll have to wait your turn like everyone else while I get it sorted.
What was that about?
Lenny needs to get more medical supplies, the cooks need ice, and the gunnery folks want more training with you.
There's only so much time in the day to handle all this.
I think I have an idea.

Fields.MenuText: You? An idea?
I hesitate to ask.
... All right, then.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm allowed to have 'em, y'know!
It ain't as bad as ya make it out to be!
Brace yourself, then!
Why not give them control over those things?
Cap'n?
We'll table this for now. Meet me in my cabin later.
So why're we discussin' this here?
You do realise that as captain, I'm in charge of this ship, right?
Aye. And?
You can't just hand over control of the ship to the crew. There's got to be some discipline.
Cap'n, they're not savages. Handing any control to the proletariat is always going to be difficult for the bourgeoisie.
But it can only improve the condition of all, starting with the working classes!

Fields.MenuText: Did... did you just get possessed by the ghost of Marx?
I had no idea you could use such big words.
Next you'll be saying to break the bondage of class itself.

Fields.DialogueText: Still workin' on his stuff. I'm more of an Engels girl.
Oh, very funny, Cap'n!
I mean, it's not that bad of an idea.
At least hear me out before you torpedo the initiative!
Fine. Let's start from the beginning.
Well, we'd need to get through quite a lot of theory in order to--
*ALARM*
Let's pretend I'm up to speed. Later.
Oh, thanks, Cap'n! One problem at a time, though...
@BATTLE
An' that's it! Organise the ship into unions for the different crews an' argue equally over decisions!
And I get sole authority over battles?
Yep! An' once they've decided, we'll do whatever they've decided on! Democratic centralism at its finest!
I must say...

Fields.MenuText: It's a bold plan.

Fields.DialogueText: Bold is my middle name! Or it would be if I had one.

Fields.MenuText: It's a risky idea.

Fields.DialogueText: Risky's my favourite word!

Fields.MenuText: It's completely bonkers!

Fields.DialogueText: Predictable, comin' from the bourgeoisie!
At least try it for a bit!
I suppose it wouldn't hurt.
Great! I'll let everyone know and we'll get right on it after our next battle!
I just hope I don't regret this.
Don't worry, Cap'n! They've got communism in the Soviet Union and it hasn't gone tits up there!
*ALARM*
Let's deal with the mess in front of us before we go making any new ones.
@BATTLE
Of course it will! Lenny's gonna give us the tally an' we'll head off to do whatever's been decided on!
Let's see what he's got for us.
So you're sure this will work?
Here you go, Captain. Final tally calls for gunnery practice first, then engine maintenance and food stocks.
Thank you, Lenny.
Soooo?

Fields.MenuText: A broken clock is right twice a day.

Fields.DialogueText: But just listen to it chime!

Fields.MenuText: Maybe there is something to this communism thing...

Fields.DialogueText: That's the spirit! Power to the proletariat!

Fields.MenuText: I have to admit, I'm surprised it worked even this well.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, of course it did! I came up with the idea!
Well, I guess we'll see how well this continues to work. In the meantime, let's head off to do some gunnery drills.
Can we do some live drills on Morganas? 'Cause I sense some coming this way!
Two birds with one shell, I suppose.
@BATTLE
New orders from the Manchester Crewmembers' Party!

Fields.MenuText: Did you come up with that name yourself?
Could you just say they're from Lenny? He's the one who delivers them.
Forgive me if I don't salute and clack my heels together.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, yeah! They need a name, after all!
He's the messenger, but he delivers their will!
Who said a dictatorship of the proletariat had to be that way?
Now, they say--
*ALARM*
Hold that thought. There's Morganas incoming.
I'll show them for interrupting me!
@BATTLE
You were saying?
The crew's lookin' to take a few days off on land.
Why am I not surprised that they want a vacation?
Well, we have been out on patrol for a while.
That is true...
All right, then. A few days ashore and then right back into it.
I'm so happy that my idea is working!
I still think it might be a fluke... but it's smooth sailing so far.
Set course to the nearest port!
Eh? I thought we did fine!
Yes, but I think the crew are starting to slack.
What makes you say that, Cap'n?
Come on, we don't have all day! Let's move!
@BATTLE
Hmm. The crew looked a bit sluggish in that last battle.

Fields.MenuText: I spotted the gunnery crew at football when they should have been at their stations.

Fields.DialogueText: What's wrong with a few rounds of footy?

Fields.MenuText: The cooks have served nothing but beans on toast for the last few days.

Fields.DialogueText: You're forgetting the fried egg on top!

Fields.MenuText: One of Lenny's staff prescribed morphine for a headache.

Fields.DialogueText: Sounds like a joke. I'm sure it'd solve the headache, at least!
What's more, we haven't had a proper drill in over a week.
... I'll give you that.
I'm going to have a talk with Lenny. We need to be in top form next time a Morgana strikes.
At least so I can keep sinkin' 'em!
Where's who?
Gah! Don't do that!
Where's Manchester?
Heh, sorry, Cap'n. Couldn't help myself.
So what's goin' on with Lenny?
Your little "Manchester Crewmembers' Party" shindig.
Eh?

Fields.MenuText: I knew this was going to be a bad idea.
It worked for a while... but like all good things, it came to an end.
We need some discipline. Maybe now we ought to try out fascism.

Fields.DialogueText: But it was going so well! How could communism not work?
I'm sure we can get things back on track!
What? No! Fascism is evil!
Well, the crew have been abusing their newfound authority and slacking as much as they can get away with.
So... what do we do?
*ALARM*
First we deal with the Morganas. Then we deal with the crew.
I'll use my bat if I have to!
@BATTLE
So, Cap'n...
Hmm?
So how are we going to sort this out?

Fields.MenuText: We could try keelhauling the crew.
I could write a sternly worded letter to the "party."
I could just ignore the next vote.

Fields.DialogueText: I know what I said about usin' my bat on 'em, but that's a bit harsh!
Er, I think we need something stronger than that.
But Cap'n! It's what they voted... oh. Right.
We need something to shock them into forgetting about the whole voting thing.
... How about a few Morgana attacks?
Huh?
Well, you said they'd been spendin' too much time relaxin' instead of doin' useful stuff, right?
I think I see what you're getting at, and I don't like it.
What's the worst that could happen? Let's start with those Morganas over there. Into the fray!
@BATTLE
Cap'n! We've got more of 'em comin' in!
You do realize the crew is still recovering from the last battle?
@BATTLE
Well, I wish you had said a bit sooner, 'cause we're gettin' in gun range!
I know you mean well, Manchester, but the crew is getting run ragged.
You were the one who said about wanting to get them sorted out!

Fields.MenuText: You could have gotten us sunk if you weren't careful.
Getting them in line is one thing. Rushing into a Morgana's waiting guns is another.
I'm beginning to think they would prefer keelhauling.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm always careful! Well, as careful as one can be in a scrap.
I don't think I've seen them move as fast to take on Morganas as they did!
Oh, come on, Cap'n! It could have been worse!
Besides! They've started chattin' about wanting to get training back on the menu!
I suppose. Still, I want to make sure this doesn't happen again. Without resorting to throwing them into combat.
Oh, take away my fun, why don't ya!
I know you all meant well, but I think it's time to put this whole party-union thing on ice.
Sorry, Captain. We let it go to our heads.
Apology accepted. Now get back to your actual duties. We have to get back up to speed.
I'm still disappointed that this didn't work, ya know.

Fields.MenuText: And that is why ships are usually tightly run by their commanding officers.

Fields.DialogueText: You have to admit that it worked well at the start!

Fields.MenuText: I'm morbidly curious to know what would have happened if this had worked.

Fields.DialogueText: It would have been a great inspiration to ships everywhere!

Fields.MenuText: I wonder if I can add "union buster" to my CV.

Fields.DialogueText: That's not exactly a badge of honour!
Well, regardless, everything is back to normal.
Back to bloodying up Morganas, then! I spy some nice candidates just over there!
@BATTLE
Hmm? Why wouldn't I be?

Fields.MenuText: There was a distinct lack of a red-haired peeping tom in the showers this morning.

Fields.DialogueText: You all right, Manchester?

Fields.MenuText: You've been quiet today. You haven't even been reading  any pulp novels.
You didn't want to run down the last batch of Morganas we fought.

Fields.DialogueText: I thought I'd give them a break for a day.
Di'n't feel like it much.
They were well whipped and the crew's just coming back to full strength.
Come on, Manchester.
I just thought that maybe one of my ideas could've resulted in something good for the crew.
It isn't all bad. Last I heard, the complaints had slowed down.
Yeah, but still... I wanted to help.
Hmm... I think I have an idea.
Eh? What is it?
*ALARM*
Take care of these Morganas and I'll tell you!
On it!
@BATTLE
So what is it you wanted to tell me, Cap'n?
I was just thinking that there might be something else you could do to help.
Still waitin', Cap'n!
Let's see you fight as good as you wait!
@BATTLE
And what would that be?

Fields.MenuText: You could maybe organise the crew into a football team.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't know how any Yanks would fare with it. Stewart might be a better Belle for that.

Fields.MenuText: How about unionising the ship under me to report to the INPF?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not sure how making one giant union would be better than what we did before.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe ease back on the pranks?

Fields.DialogueText: I mean, I have already. But it's not like I'm harming anyone with 'em.
Hmm...
Wait, I think I 'ave an idea! How about a suggestion box?
That's... not that bad of an idea, actually.
Great! I'll get to work on it! Maybe this time one of my ideas won't go down the toilet...
Ta-da!
Hmm...

Fields.MenuText: You could have done it in any color... and you chose red?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh! I forgot the blue! Thanks for reminding me! Can't have United without City!

Fields.MenuText: Is that safe? I think I see a nail poking out of it.

Fields.DialogueText: You try hammerin' when the ship is rockin' back and forth!

Fields.MenuText: Thank goodness you're not a carpenter, or else you'd be fired.

Fields.DialogueText: There's only so much you can do with driftwood!
Still, I can appreciate the effort. Needs some refinement, but it could maybe work.
Of course it'll work! It's my idea, innit?
So was the unionisation.
Yeah, yeah...
At least I'll be vetting the suggestions. That way any nonsense can be stopped.
*ALARM*
I'll have somethin' for you to vet once I've finished off the Morganas!
@BATTLE
On it!
All right, it's been a full day since we put the suggestion box up. Let's see what we got.

Fields.MenuText: Please tell me you're responsible for the fish.
Did some of these sailors never learn how to write?
Why is there a half-eaten tin of beans here?

Fields.DialogueText: Guess the cooks didn't get 'em all.
Oi, that's my handwriting!
I hid it in the Lieutenant's bunk under his pillow! He must have snuck it here.
Better than nothing, I suppose. I'm surprised there's so many of these.
Just shows how excited they are to give it a go!
*ALARM*
I suppose the Morganas want to give their suggestions.
I've got several rebuttals!
@BATTLE
Might have? Di'n't you have any confidence in it?
I've got to hand it to you, Manchester. This actually might have worked out.

Fields.MenuText: Can I choose not to answer?

Fields.DialogueText: Depends on the answer.

Fields.MenuText: A hundred percent confidence.

Fields.DialogueText: That's what I thought!

Fields.MenuText: Absolutely not.

Fields.DialogueText: Have a bit o' faith!
Regardless, the suggestions are mostly constructive. Different variety of food, stopping you spooking sailors in the showers--
What's wrong with me spookin' the sailors? It's all in good fun.
Besides, I know there's a few of them that like it.
Just give it up for a bit and see how it goes. Maybe our crew will get closer to 110 percent.
*ALARM*
Let's stomp those Morganas down to zero first! Then we can put the plans into action.
@BATTLE
Captain, I just wanted to thank you for implementing the suggestions. I don't think I've ever seen the crew so happy.
Thank Manchester. She was the one who came up with the idea.
'Twas nothin'!
In particular, the gunners have enjoyed the new practice schedules. It lets them get plenty of shifts in.
How about we test 'em on some Morganas and see how they fare?
Not a bad idea.
Good, 'cause I know where to find some!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: I think they still need a bit more practice.
Not bad for a start.
I can't believe they're this good already.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, ya can't expect 'em to be amazing right off the bat!
For a start!? I thought they did great!
Next they'll be able to snipe the hat off of Kongou!
Please don't cause an international incident.
Don't worry! I'm sure I can take it off clean!
Well, let's give it some time and see how things go.
You won't have to wait long. We'll be the best ship in the fleet!
I'm still upset that I've had to ease back on the pranks.
Gunners are improving by the day, the chefs are better stocked with food--
No buckets above my door, no missing bandages for pranks...

Fields.MenuText: I nearly had my cabin burned down thanks to that fake spider you put in there.

Fields.DialogueText: I didn't know you could scream so high!

Fields.MenuText: I'm pretty sure Lenny prefers to stay as dry as possible.

Fields.DialogueText: A bit o' water never killed anyone!

Fields.MenuText: The sailors are glad they can enjoy a shower without any temperature changes.

Fields.DialogueText: I saw you laughing at them stumblin' around last time!
Still, I'm glad that one of your ideas ended up working out. Plus it gives the crew some say in what gets done.
Nothing like a bit of class consciousness!
I'm still coming to terms a bit with you being a communist.
I fight the same as the rest of the fleet, don't I?
*ALARM*
Can't argue with that. Care to show off?
Always!
@BATTLE
Oi! Keep your chains to yourselves, you spooky reactionaries!
Hmm?

Fields.MenuText: Wouldn't it be the same result?

Fields.DialogueText: We learned from it, di'n't we? Correct the problems!

Fields.MenuText: When all's said and done, Manc's fun to have around. Even if some of her ideas are... out there.
Maybe I need a bit more chaos in my life. She's certainly got it in spades...

Fields.DialogueText: @BATTLE
Ya know... I still wish we could have made it work.
The unionisation of the ship. Maybe if we tried again...

Fields.MenuText: I thought we were trying fascism next time.

Fields.DialogueText: It'll be a cold day in Hell when I go near fascism!

Fields.MenuText: We could try Stalinism where I'm in command.

Fields.DialogueText: That's nowhere close to Engels and Marx's ideals.
Besides, I'm sure the crew would behave better with their newfound experience.
Manchester, I appreciate your concern, but I think we're in a decent spot already.
Oh, all right. I'll drop it.
Thank you, Manchester.
... Oh! Look at the time! I've got to be on my way!
What for?
Leningrad and some of the other Soviet Belles were putting together a discussion on communism. I'm invited!
I've been reading and reading since port to study up!
Don't fry your brain, Manc.
Oh, very funny, Captain!
Who put a whoopee cushion on my chair? Manc!
